forum.name: Number Talks and Formative Assessment Video Observation
forum.intro:
In Module 2 we discussed instructional routines that engage students in deep learning. One of those routines was number talks. Number talks have increased in popularity, and when executed properly, consistently engage students in mathematical discourse and make thinking visible. 

In this activity, you will watch a video of Cathy Humphreys engaging adult learners in a number talk. Humphreys co-authored Making Number Talks Matter and is considered an expert on number talks.[1]

As you watch the video, think about the following:

  • How can number talks be used as a formative assessment routine?
  • How does Humphreys set up the number talk?
  • What questions does/doesn’t she ask students during the number talk?
  • What are one or two moments in the video that you find particularly interesting? Why?

Video:  Cathy Humphreys Teaching a Number Talk (from youcubed at Stanford)

Discussion

Select 1–2 timestamps from the video that were interesting to you and share them in the discussion forum below. Click ADD DISCUSSION TOPIC to add a post to the forum. Describe what is happening at the timestamps and what you found interesting.

Remember to read and respond to others’ postings. (Click “Discuss this topic” on an individual post, then click “Reply” to respond to that post.)

[1] Humphreys, C. & Parker, R. (2015). Making number talks matter: Developing mathematical practices and deepening understanding, grades 4–10. Stenhouse Publishers.
